intro: Phymaspermum aciculare, commonly known as the needleleaf phymaspermum, is a small, evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by hard, woody fruits containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
